intro: Tectaridium, commonly known as the "spider plant," is a member of the Asparagaceae family. It is a low-growing, herbaceous plant characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. The plant is native to southern Africa and thrives in well-drained soil with moderate sunlight. It is known for its ability to produce offsets, making it easy to propagate. Tectaridium is also noted for its air-purifying qualities and is often used in indoor gardening.
